newsitem.title: USA: Scott's Liquid settles environmental suit.
newsitem.headline: Scott's Liquid settles environmental suit.

text.p: Scott's Liquid Gold Inc said on Tuesday that it has agreed to settle an environmental lawsuit brought against it by the U.S. Justice Department for $6 million.

According to Scott's, the lawsuit, which the Justice Department filed on behalf of the U.S. Army, alleges the company was a contributor to contamination in a groundwater aquifer underlying a portion of the Rocky Mountain Arsenal.
The settlement consists of a payment of $1 million in cash, $2 million payable by the company over eight years with interest, and $3 million from insurance carriers.
Scott's said some insurers who provided liability coverage to the company during the relevant period did not participate in the settlement.
The company said it intends to pursue recovery from these carriers of the full amounts it pays in the settlement.
